condition: I don't know what to do with my child
condition_name: I don't know what to do with my chil
message_text: @fields.child_nickname

It is completely normal to experience this, it can be really hard for the whole family to adjust to remote learning. Try making a weekly plan with @fields.child_nickname. Include educational, relaxation and fun activities activities so that it balanced and enjoyable for @fields.child_nickname. You can do this!

It is completely normal to experience this, it can be really hard for the whole family to adjust to remote learning. Try making a weekly plan with your child. Include educational, relaxation and fun activities activities so that it balanced and enjoyable for your child. You can do this!

condition: My child does not want to learn
condition_name: My child does not want to learn
message_text: @fields.child_nickname

Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. Try thinking of playful and interesting ways to teach @fields.child_nickname their school curriculum. Children are interested in learning if they are having fun. If you need any tips on fun ideas type "Help".

Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. Try thinking of playful and interesting ways to teach your child their school curriculum. Children are interested in learning if they are having fun. If you need any tips on fun ideas type "Help".
@fields.child_nickname
It is completely normal to feel overwhelmed. Try staying in touch with @fields.child_nickname's teacher or school to receive some guidance. Asking for help is a sign of strength. You can do this!
It is completely normal to feel overwhelmed. Try staying in touch with your child's teacher or school to receive some guidance. Asking for help is a sign of strength. You can do this!

condition: I did not have the time to involve myself in my child's learning or education
condition_name: I did not have the time to involve m
message_text: @fields.child_nickname

It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else. Can you think of a time each day that you can make 5 minutes or a bit more to help @fields.child_nickname with their learning? Perhaps try starting them off on an activity and then checking in with them every few minutes. You can do it!
